availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrodsburg, Kentucky, judge. Kentucky native. Married Sarah W. S. Chinn. Trustee of the Methodist church in Harrodsburg, Kentucky. County Judge of the Mercer County Court in Harrodsburg in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved people in Harrodsburg in 1860.

bibl.p:
Notable Kentucky African Americans Database, "Madison (Chinn slave)"
http://nkaa.uky.edu/record.php?noteid=2867 (accessed August 15, 2017); _Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer county, Harrodsburg, p. 5; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer county, Harrodsburg, p. 2.
